Sure, here is a revised four-week training program that focuses on collar chokes, chokes, and strangles in Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu (BJJ), with an emphasis on the top options and without live drilling:

1. Week 1: Fundamentals of collar chokes
* In this week, focus on learning the basics of collar chokes in BJJ.
* Practice executing the top collar chokes, such as the collar-and-sleeve choke and the brabo choke, on a dummy or training partner.
* Work on improving your understanding of the mechanics and principles of collar chokes.
2. Week 2: Gi grips and control
* Spend this week focusing on improving your grip and control game in BJJ.
* Practice executing the top grips, such as the lapel grip and sleeve grip, on a dummy or training partner.
* Work on using the grips to control your opponent and set up collar chokes.
3. Week 3: Chokes and strangles
* In this week, focus on mastering the top chokes and strangles in BJJ.
* Practice executing the top chokes and strangles, such as the triangle choke and rear-naked choke, on a dummy or training partner.
* Work on improving your defense against chokes and strangles and escaping from bad positions.
4. Week 4: Theory and visualization
* Spend this week focusing on the theory and visualization of the techniques you have learned in BJJ.
* Review the mechanics and principles of collar chokes, grips, and chokes and strangles.
* Practice visualizing yourself executing the techniques on a dummy or training partner.

Remember to always warm up before training, and to train with a partner if possible. It's also important to listen to your body and take regular breaks to avoid injury. Most importantly, have fun and enjoy the journey of learning BJJ!
